citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Female Shih Tzu (#77)'s eyes were gray/hazy on the surface and the white part of the eyeball was reddened and eyelids
were crusted with some wet hair. These are signs of an active eye problem that was pointed out during inspection and
wasn't under treatment or by the facility. Untreated eye problems could worsen and cause discomfort. Ensure that this
dog's eyes are seen by the attending veterinarian for treatment guidance and follow the treatment plan.
***Correct by 1/10/2025.

Three adult dogs had empty water bowls at the time of inspection. The licensee provided them water and they did not
drink much when given water or appear thirsty, however regulations require that they have access to potable water at all
times. Access to potable water at all times helps promote the health of the dogs. If water bowls are used, ensure that they
are checked and filled often enough to ensure that dogs always have access to potable water.
***Correct from 1/7/2025 forward.

Female Shih Tzu (tag #77) had matted hair by her face and areas of loosely matted hair on her legs and tail. Matted hair
can cause discomfort and skin problems. To provide for their health, ensure dogs hair is maintained free from matting.
***Correct by 1/11/2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Female Shih Tzu (#77)'s eyes were gray/hazy on the surface and the white part of the eyeball was reddened and eyelids 
were crusted with some wet hair. These are signs of an active eye problem that was pointed out during inspection and 
wasn't under treatment or by the facility. Untreated eye problems could worsen and cause discomfort. Ensure that this 
dog's eyes are seen by the attending veterinarian for treatment guidance and follow the treatment plan.  
***Correct by 1/10/2025. 
3.10(a) 
   
Watering 
Three adult dogs had empty water bowls at the time of inspection. The licensee provided them water and they did not 
drink much when given water or appear thirsty, however regulations require that they have access to potable water at all 
times. Access to potable water at all times helps promote the health of the dogs. If water bowls are used, ensure that they 
are checked and filled often enough to ensure that dogs always have access to potable water.  
***Correct from 1/7/2025 forward. 
3.13(a)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Female Shih Tzu (tag #77) had matted hair by her face and areas of loosely matted hair on her legs and tail. Matted hair 
can cause discomfort and skin problems. To provide for their health, ensure dogs hair is maintained free from matting.  
***Correct by 1/11/2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
